meanings.definition: A thin layer of microorganisms that adhere to a surface.
meanings.sent1: The biofilm on the pond rocks was teeming with tiny creatures.
meanings.sent2: The dentist explained how biofilm can build up on teeth if not brushed regularly.
meanings.sent3: The biofilm on the bathroom mirror seemed to be waving hello.
meanings.sent4: The biofilm covering the old shipwreck was like a living blanket.
meanings.sent5: The biofilm under the microscope looked like a bustling city from above.

meanings.definition: A complex community of microorganisms embedded in a matrix of extracellular polymeric substances.
meanings.sent1: The biofilm in the soil played a crucial role in nutrient recycling.
meanings.sent2: Scientists are studying how biofilm formation can impact water quality.
meanings.sent3: The biofilm in the petri dish seemed to be having a party.
meanings.sent4: The biofilm in the river was a hidden world of microscopic interactions.
meanings.sent5: The biofilm on the reef was like a bustling underwater metropolis.
